result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M McClain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

No use/possession of firearms
No use/possession of body armour
DE ineligible for voting until civil rights are restrored
Will be eligible for SAP and CIP if revoked.
DE will provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge

Defendant Christopher M McClain in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant Christopher M McClain in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF15, 16CF18, 17CF44, 17CT24, 17CT28.  

16CF15-16CF18- Civil Judgment will be entered for unpaid court obligations.  Has an Imposed/Stayed sentence

17CF44-DE will waive PH, court instructs on waiver of PH, DE understands, court will accept waiver.  Court finds probable cause exits, will bind over for JT.  Information filed this day in 17CF44-DE will enter a plea on this charge.  Court recites agreement into the court record.  Court instucts on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.
Sentence will be withheld, 24 month probation, consecutive to all other cases.  DE will pay CC, DNA sample/Surcharge, no firearms, no voting, maintain absolute sobriety, apply to Rusk county drug court, comply with all conditions imposed by DOC.  

17CT24, 17CT28 will be DRI

15CF83-One year jail, concurrent to other cases, has credit for 221 days, CV judgment for unpaid court obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 15, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 26, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR
